movies.title: Attempt to Kill
movies.plot: A wealthy business man fires one of his employees and becomes the victim of murder attempt. The fired man becomes the prime suspect, but it appears that he himself has been murdered.
movies.simplePlot: A wealthy business man fires one of his employees and becomes the victim of murder attempt. The fired man becomes the prime suspect, but it appears that he himself has been murdered.

biography.bio: Grace Arnold was born on September 19, 1894 in London, England. She was an actress, known for Went the Day Well? (1942), A Day of Grace (1956) and The Maid of Domrémy (1954). She died on February 26, 1979 in London.
biography.name: Grace Arnold

biography.bio: Frances Bennett was born on December 22, 1930 in Simla, West Bengal, India as Felicité Jan Shirley Barrington. She was an actress and writer, known for Compact (1962), A Life of Bliss (1960) and Can I Keep It Up for a Week? (1975). She was married to John McMichael. She died on March 5, 2014 in Denville Hall, Northwood, London, England.
biography.name: Frances Bennett

biography.bio: J.G. Devlin was born on October 8, 1907 in Belfast, Ireland [now Northern Ireland], UK as James Gerard Devlin. He was an actor, known for Far and Away (1992), Darby O'Gill and the Little People (1959) and The Miracle (1991). He was married to Veen. He died on October 17, 1991 in Belfast, Northern Ireland.
biography.name: J.G. Devlin

biography.bio: Clifford Earl was born on August 29, 1933 in England. He was an actor, known for Tales from the Crypt (1972), Scream and Scream Again (1970) and Le commando de sa majesté (1980). He was married to Beth. He died on July 30, 2015 in Kent, England.
biography.name: Clifford Earl

biography.bio: Derek Farr was born on February 7, 1912 in London, England. He was an actor, known for The Dam Busters (1955), Double Confession (1950) and The Man in the Road (1956). He was married to Muriel Pavlow and Carole Lynne. He died on March 22, 1986 in London.
biography.name: Derek Farr

biography.bio: Denis Holmes was born on June 7, 1921 in Foleshill, Coventry, England. He was an actor, known for Sabrina (1995), Moonlighting (1982) and Speed for Thespians (2000). He died on May 27, 2013 in the USA.
biography.name: Denis Holmes

biography.bio: Freda Jackson was born in Nottingham, England in 1908, the daughter of a railway porter. After studying at High Pavement School and the University College there, she became a schoolteacher but gave up her career to study acting at the Royal College of Art, in London. Her first professional stage appearance was in Northampton, England in 1934, before moving on to London's West End in 1936. In 1938 she joined the prestigious Old Vic company, touring with them in Europe and Egypt. She played Shakespeare at Stratford on Avon in 1940, but it was in 1945 that she gained fame in 'No Room at the Inn' in London. Following this success she went on to play many starring roles. In total Freda Jackson appeared in some sixty two major stage roles in England and overseas. At the same time she appeared in twenty six films, including Sir Laurence Olivier's 'Henry V', David Lean's version of Dicken's 'Great Expectations', Tony Richardson's 'Tom Jones', and the Hammer Horror classic 'Brides of Dracula'. Not content with this she also appeared in several classic British television shows, including Maigret, Adam Adamant Lives, and Blake's 7, together with a number of more serious dramas. Freda Jackson, who was married to the painter Henry Bird ARCA, died in 1990.
biography.name: Freda Jackson

biography.bio: Allan Jeager is an actor, known for Attempt to Kill (1961) and The Edgar Wallace Mystery Theatre (1960).
biography.name: Allan Jeager

biography.bio: Patricia Mort was born in 1933 in Swansea, Wales. She is an actress, known for Ring Out an Alibi (1964), Late Harvest (1960) and That Kind of Girl (1963).
biography.name: Patricia Mort

biography.bio: Richard Pearson was born on August 1, 1918 in Monmouth, Gwent, Wales as Richard de Pearsall Pearson. He was an actor, known for The Wind in the Willows (1984), The Wind in the Willows (1983) and Sunday Bloody Sunday (1971). He was married to Patricia Dickson. He died on August 2, 2011 in Northwood, Hillingdon, London, England.
biography.name: Richard Pearson

biography.bio: Trevor Reid was born on January 25, 1908 in Liverpool, England. He was an actor, known for The Narrowing Circle (1956), Meet Mr. Callaghan (1954) and Behind the Headlines (1956). He died on April 19, 1965 in London, England.
biography.name: Trevor Reid

biography.bio: Tony Wright was born on December 10, 1925 in London, England. He was an actor, known for The House in Marsh Road (1960), The Spaniard's Curse (1958) and Plus de whisky pour Callaghan! (1955). He was married to Janet Munro. He died on June 7, 1986 in London.
biography.name: Tony Wright
